Metadata.Title: Only Trusted Certificates Are Used
Metadata.Author: Serge Batchilo, Jason Taylor, Joe Basirico

Content.Data:
Applies to

  • PCI DSS Requirement 4.1
  • PCI DSS Requirement 4.1.b

What to Check For

If SSL or TLS is used, only trusted certificates or keys should be accepted.

Why

Using a trusted key or certificate prevents an attacker from posing as a trusted party or substituting the key to be able to decrypt the transmission.

How to Check

Identify whether SSL or TLS is used. Identify all the certificates and keys used to encrypt the transmissions. Make sure that all the used keys and certificates are trusted by examining the certificates and keys and interviewing the issuing parties.

How to Fix

Identify whether SSL or TLS is used. Identify all the certificates and keys used to encrypt the transmissions. Verify that all the used keys and certificates are authorized by examining the certificates and keys and interviewing the issuing parties. Add all the used keys and certificates to the trusted certificates or keys list of each respective application, such as a web browser.
